title: (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2023 (S.I. No.
heading: 1. (1) These regulations may be cited as the Oireachtas (Allowances and
text_raw:
1. (1) These regulations may be cited as the Oireachtas (Allowances and 

Facilities) (Amendment) Regulations 2023. 

(2) These regulations come into operation on 26 April 2023.
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited oireachtas (allowances facilities) (amendment) regulation 2023 (2) regulation come operation 26 april 2023

title: (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2023 (S.I. No.
heading: 2. The Oireachtas (Allowances and Facilities) Regulations (S.I. No. 84 of
text_raw:
2. The Oireachtas (Allowances and Facilities) Regulations (S.I. No. 84 of 

2010) is amended by inserting after Regulation 11 the following: 

“11A. Allowance in respect of security measures 

(1) Where a member of either House of the Oireachtas incurs expenses 
in enhancing the security of their staff, home or offices, for the purpose 
of safely performing the member’s parliamentary duties, the Clerk of 
Dáil Éireann shall pay on a once-off basis to the member a sum not 
exceeding €5,000, or 50% of their total costs, whichever is the lesser, 
(“security requirements 
the expenses, 
in 
allowance”) following receipt of claim for the expenses. 

final settlement of 

(2) A claim for payment of a sum under this Regulation shall be made 
to the appropriate authority in such form and contain such particulars 
as the Oireachtas Commission from time to time directs.” 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

26 April, 2023. 

PASCHAL DONOHOE, 

Minister for Public Expenditure, National Development 
Plan Delivery and Reform. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 28th April, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [196] 3
